question.title: Will the CMA announce completion of a major pharmaceutical pricing investigation by July 2024?

question.title: Will NASA's Orion capsule complete a crewed return mission from the ISS by August 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, NASA's Orion capsule successfully completes a crewed return mission from the International Space Station (ISS) to Earth. For a positive resolution:

1. The mission must involve the Orion capsule transporting at least one human crew member from the ISS back to Earth.
2. The capsule must land safely with all crew members in good health.
3. The mission's success must be officially confirmed by NASA or another authoritative space agency.
4. The confirmation must be reported by at least two major, reputable news outlets (e.g., Associated Press, Reuters, BBC, CNN, New York Times).

The question will resolve as NO if:
- No such mission occurs by the specified date.
- A mission is attempted but fails to meet all the above criteria.
- The Orion capsule is used only for uncrewed missions or launches to the ISS without a return flight.

Note: This question does not consider test flights or simulations. Only actual crewed return missions from the ISS count towards resolution.

1. No mission involving the Orion capsule transporting at least one human crew member from the ISS back to Earth occurs by the specified date.
2. Any mission attempted fails to land the capsule safely with all crew members in good health.
3. The mission's success is not officially confirmed by NASA or another authoritative space agency.
4. The confirmation is not reported by at least two major, reputable news outlets (e.g., Associated Press, Reuters, BBC, CNN, New York Times).

The question will resolve as NO if:
- The Orion capsule successfully completes a crewed return mission meeting all the above criteria by the specified date.

Note: This question does not consider test flights or simulations. Only actual crewed return missions from the ISS count towards resolution.

The declaration must be confirmed through official CDC announcements or reports from at least three reputable news sources (such as Reuters, Associated Press, or BBC). The outbreak referred to in this question is the one that prompted the CDC to issue public health warnings. If no such declaration ending the outbreak is made by the resolution date, or if the CDC extends the emergency status beyond August 31, 2024, the question will resolve as NO.

question.title: Will the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention not declare the current mpox outbreak over by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) does not officially declare the ongoing mpox outbreak over by August 31, 2024. This includes scenarios where no declaration ending the outbreak is made by the resolution date, or if the CDC extends the emergency status beyond August 31, 2024. The declaration must be confirmed through official CDC announcements or reports from at least three reputable news sources (such as Reuters, Associated Press, or BBC). The outbreak referred to in this question is the one that prompted the CDC to issue public health warnings. If the CDC officially declares the outbreak over by the resolution date, the question will resolve as NO.

question.title: Will the Australian Government announce conversion of additional vehicles to biofuel by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the Australian Government officially announces that additional vehicles, beyond those already known, have been converted or are in the process of being converted to run on biofuel. The announcement must come from official government channels or be reported by at least two major, reputable news outlets (such as BBC, Reuters, Associated Press, or The Guardian). The additional vehicles must be part of the government fleet or directly associated with governmental transportation. If no such announcement is made by the specified date, the question will resolve as NO.

question.title: Will the Australian Government not announce conversion of additional vehicles to biofuel by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the Australian Government does not officially announce that additional vehicles, beyond those already known, have been converted or are in the process of being converted to run on biofuel. The absence of such an announcement from official government channels or from at least two major, reputable news outlets (such as BBC, Reuters, Associated Press, or The Guardian) will result in a YES resolution. If such an announcement is made by the specified date, the question will resolve as NO.

question.title: Will Baidu's donation cover full tuition for all Zhejiang University engineering students by July 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by July 31, 2024, it is officially confirmed that Baidu's donation is being used to cover full tuition for all engineering students at Zhejiang University, regardless of their family income. The confirmation must come from official university announcements or reports from at least two reputable news sources. If the donation does not cover full tuition for all engineering students by the resolution date, or if it only covers tuition for a subset of students based on income or other criteria, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will Baidu's donation not cover full tuition for all Zhejiang University engineering students by July 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by July 31, 2024, it is not officially confirmed that Baidu's donation is being used to cover full tuition for all engineering students at Zhejiang University, regardless of their family income. The confirmation must come from official university announcements or reports from at least two reputable news sources. If the donation covers full tuition for all engineering students by the resolution date, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will North Carolina's abortion law allowing procedures up to 20 weeks remain unchanged by August 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by August 31, 2024, North Carolina's current abortion law permitting abortions up to 20 weeks remains in effect without any changes. The status of the law must be confirmed by official state legislative records or reported by at least two major news outlets (such as Associated Press, Reuters, or local North Carolina newspapers). If the law is modified, replaced, or overturned by the specified date, the question resolves as NO. This includes any changes that either restrict or expand the current 20-week limit.

question.title: Will North Carolina's abortion law allowing procedures up to 20 weeks be changed by August 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by August 31, 2024, North Carolina's current abortion law permitting abortions up to 20 weeks is modified, replaced, or overturned. The status of the law must be confirmed by official state legislative records or reported by at least two major news outlets (such as Associated Press, Reuters, or local North Carolina newspapers). If the law remains unchanged by the specified date, the question resolves as NO. This includes any changes that either restrict or expand the current 20-week limit.

question.title: Will Blake Lively's "It Ends With Us" outgross her husband Ryan Reynold's "Deadpool & Wolverine" this weekend?
question.body:
Resolution 

This market resolves YES "It Ends with Us" has a higher (domestic) gross than "Deadpool & Wolverine" for the weekend of August 9-11. 

Source: The "weekend" tab in BoxOfficeMojo, for August 9-11.

I will use the number listed by BoxOfficeMojo, however it is defined (e.g. typically 3-day FSS wekeend + previews).

Example: last weekend, the "Deadpool & Wolverine" grossed $96.8M, far ahead of the "Trap", which opened to $15.4M.

Context 

"Deadpool & Wolverine" has been crushing the box office, and is expected to repeat with its 3rd weekend at #1. 

The potential long shot that could dethrone it is "It Ends With Us", the adaptation of Colleen Hoover's mega-bestseller, starring (funnily enough) Ryan Reynold's wife, Blake Lively.

question.title: Will Asa Hutchinson be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Asa Hutchinson is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently considered; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

question.title: Will Asa Hutchinson not be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Asa Hutchinson is not selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. If any candidate other than Asa Hutchinson is selected, this question will resolve as **Yes**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently considered; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

question.title: [Metaculus] Will diplomatic expulsions or recalls take place between the Philippines and China before August 1, 2024?
question.body:
Will diplomatic expulsions or recalls take place between the Philippines and China before August 1, 2024?

Resolves the same as the original on Metaculus.

(https://www.metaculus.com/questions/question_embed/24034/?theme=dark)Resolution criteria

This question resolves as Yes if before August 1, 2024, one of these four events happens, according to official statements or credible reports:

The Philippines expels at least one diplomat representing the People's Republic of China (PRC).

The Philippines recalls at least one of its diplomats stationed in the PRC.

The PRC expels at least one diplomat representing the Philippines.

The PRC recalls at least one of its diplomats stationed in the Philippines.

If there are no such reports before that date, then this resolves as No.

Fine print and additional background information can be found on Metaculus.

Once the original resolves, its resolution will be applied to this market automatically. Trustworthy-ish users are encouraged to resolve this market before then if the outcome is known and unambiguous. Feel free to ping @jskf to request early resolution or to report issues.

question.title: [Metaculus] Will no diplomatic expulsions or recalls take place between the Philippines and China before August 1, 2024?
question.body:
Will no diplomatic expulsions or recalls take place between the Philippines and China before August 1, 2024?

Resolves the opposite of the original on Metaculus.

(https://www.metaculus.com/questions/question_embed/24034/?theme=dark)Resolution criteria

This question resolves as Yes if before August 1, 2024, none of these four events happen, according to official statements or credible reports:

The Philippines does not expel any diplomat representing the People's Republic of China (PRC).

The Philippines does not recall any of its diplomats stationed in the PRC.

The PRC does not expel any diplomat representing the Philippines.

The PRC does not recall any of its diplomats stationed in the Philippines.

If there are any such reports before that date, then this resolves as No.

Fine print and additional background information can be found on Metaculus.

Once the original resolves, its resolution will be applied to this market automatically. Trustworthy-ish users are encouraged to resolve this market before then if the outcome is known and unambiguous. Feel free to ping @jskf to request early resolution or to report issues.

question.title: Will UCLA hold its in-person, university-wide graduation commencement ceremonies scheduled for June 14, 2024?
question.body:
This question resolves as **Yes** if the University of California-Los Angeles (UCLA) holds all three of its main in-person college commencement ceremonies for the graduating Class of 2024 [scheduled](https://commencement.ucla.edu/schedule/ucla-commencement-schedule-alphabetical#college) for the following times and locations on June 14, 2024:

- 11 AM at the Pauley Pavilion
- 3 PM at the Pauley Pavilion
- 7 PM at the Pauley Pavilion

The ceremonies must all occur at the specified locations and begin within 1 hour of the scheduled starting time. 

This question will resolve as **No** if any ceremony either does not begin within an hour of the scheduled time, is moved to another location, or is held entirely online (i.e., without graduates, faculty, and guests attending in person).

question.title: Will UCLA not hold its in-person, university-wide graduation commencement ceremonies scheduled for June 14, 2024?
question.body:
This question resolves as **Yes** if the University of California-Los Angeles (UCLA) does not hold all three of its main in-person college commencement ceremonies for the graduating Class of 2024 as scheduled for the following times and locations on June 14, 2024:

- 11 AM at the Pauley Pavilion
- 3 PM at the Pauley Pavilion
- 7 PM at the Pauley Pavilion

The question will resolve as **Yes** if any ceremony either does not begin within an hour of the scheduled time, is moved to another location, or is held entirely online (i.e., without graduates, faculty, and guests attending in person).

This question will resolve as **No** if all ceremonies occur at the specified locations and begin within 1 hour of the scheduled starting time.

question.title: Will there be a break between Chainsaw Man chapters 173 and 174?
question.body:
A break can be any amount of time, enough for Shonen Jump to state at the end of chapters if there will be a break before the next one.

“YES” = “Yes, there will be a break after chapter 173”

“NO” = “No, there will not be a break after chapter 173”

Plan to close this on official release, will close earlier if known-accurate leakers post any details about a break ahead of time. I do not vote in my own questions.

question.title: Will at least 30% of Manifold respondents agree that weak AGI had been achieved before July 23, 2024?
question.body:
[image]Every month, a Manifold poll is being posted to gain the consensus view of progress towards AGI. Unlike many of the markets and questions on Manifold, these polls will simply ask "has weak AGI been achieved," rather than providing a definition of the term. The goal is that given that the term is so broad, the only way to characterize AI progress is also to allow respondents to vote based upon their own understanding.

Progress has been steady.  The previous polls are referenced here:

@/SteveSokolowski/did-openai-achieve-weak-agi-with-gp  (Answer: 15)

@/SteveSokolowski/june-2024-has-weak-agi-been-achieve  (Answer: 27)

The previous markets on this topic, which significantly understimated Manifold's belief in AI progress, were:

@/SteveSokolowski/what-percentage-of-manifold-poll-re 

@/SteveSokolowski/will-at-least-20-of-manifold-respon 

The polls will not reference any specific model, and will not define "AGI" except to state that the poll does not require that the software system be able to manipulate the physical world. The polls open on the 23rd of each month and close on the 30th.

This market will resolve to YES if the July 2024 poll results in a ratio of YES/(NO + YES) greater than or equal to 0.3. The "no opinion" respondents will be ignored. Otherwise, this question will resolve to NO.

See also:

@/SteveSokolowski/will-one-of-the-monthly-has-weak-ag

question.title: Will Joe Biden announce that he is both dropping out and resigning from the presidency before the end of July?
question.body:
Resolves YES if Joe Biden announces both that he is no longer running for re-election and that he will be resigning and not completing his current term. These announcements before the end of July 2024 in Pacific Time, but he does not have to have formally resigned and be out of office before the end of July. question.title: Will 538 Project Biden as the favorite on Friday?
question.body:
This market will resolve to “Yes” if Joe Biden has a higher probability of winning the US presidential election than Donald Trump according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for the day of July 19, 2024. This market will resolve to “No” if Donald Trump has a higher probability of winning the US presidential election than Joe Biden according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for the day of July 19, 2024. If Biden and Trump have equal odds, this market will resolve 50-50.

The resolution source will be FiveThirtyEight's 2024 presidential election forecast, https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/2024-election-forecast/, specifically the numbers indicated by the blue and red trend lines for this market's resolution date. Changes in the methodology by which FiveThirtyEight calculates its figures will have no bearing on the resolution of this market.

This market will resolve according to the datapoints for July 19 as soon as datapoints for July 20 become available. This market may not resolve until the July 20 datapoints are available. If no datapoints for July 19 are available by July 22, 11:59 PM ET, this market will resolve according to the nearest previous figures to July 19.

Please note the resolution refers to the odds of each candidate winning as a number out of 100 reported to the 1 digit mark (eg. "Trump 57 times out of 100"). The listed number of simulations out of 1,000 won by each candidate will NOT be considered.

question.title: Will diplomatic expulsions or recalls take place between the Philippines and China before June 1, 2024?
question.body:
This question resolves as **Yes** if before June 1, 2024, one of these four events happens, according to official statements or [credible reports](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions): 

- The Philippines expels at least one diplomat representing the People's Republic of China (PRC). 

- The Philippines recalls at least one of its diplomats stationed in the PRC.

- The PRC expels at least one diplomat representing the Philippines.

- The PRC recalls at least one of its diplomats stationed in the Philippines. 

If there are no such reports before that date, then this resolves as **No**.

question.title: Will no diplomatic expulsions or recalls take place between the Philippines and China before June 1, 2024?
question.body:
This question resolves as **Yes** if before June 1, 2024, none of these four events happen, according to official statements or [credible reports](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions): 

- The Philippines does not expel any diplomat representing the People's Republic of China (PRC). 

- The Philippines does not recall any of its diplomats stationed in the PRC.

- The PRC does not expel any diplomat representing the Philippines.

- The PRC does not recall any of its diplomats stationed in the Philippines. 

If there are such reports before that date, then this resolves as **No**.

question.title: Iran military response before August 13th midnight Eastern Time?
question.body:
This market will resolve to "Yes" if Iran initiates a military action on Israeli soil, airspace, or maritime territory between July 30 and August 12, 2024, 11:59 PM ET. Otherwise, this market will resolve to "No".

For the purposes of this market, a "military action" will be considered to be any use of force executed by Iran on Israeli soil, airspace, or maritime territory (e.g. if a weapons depot on Israeli soil is hit by an Iranian missile, this market will resolve to "Yes") that is officially acknowledged by the Iranian government or a consensus of credible reporting. This includes, but is not limited to, airstrikes, naval attacks, or ground invasions. Cyber attacks, sanctions, or diplomatic actions will not count towards the resolution of this market.

Only responses by Iranian forces explicitly claimed by the Islamic Republic of Iran, or confirmed to have originated from Iranian territory will count toward the resolution of this market. Attacks on Israel by proxy forces (i.e. Hezbollah, Houthis, etc.) will not count toward the resolution of this market.

question.title: No Iranian military response before August 13th midnight Eastern Time?
question.body:
This market will resolve to "Yes" if Iran does not initiate a military action on Israeli soil, airspace, or maritime territory between July 30 and August 12, 2024, 11:59 PM ET. Otherwise, this market will resolve to "No".

For the purposes of this market, a "military action" will be considered to be any use of force executed by Iran on Israeli soil, airspace, or maritime territory (e.g. if a weapons depot on Israeli soil is hit by an Iranian missile, this market will resolve to "No") that is officially acknowledged by the Iranian government or a consensus of credible reporting. This includes, but is not limited to, airstrikes, naval attacks, or ground invasions. Cyber attacks, sanctions, or diplomatic actions will not count towards the resolution of this market.

Only responses by Iranian forces explicitly claimed by the Islamic Republic of Iran, or confirmed to have originated from Iranian territory will count toward the resolution of this market. Attacks on Israel by proxy forces (i.e. Hezbollah, Houthis, etc.) will not count toward the resolution of this market.

question.title: Will Donald Trump be removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
question.body:
This question will resolve as "Yes" if, *on* July 15, 2024:

Donald Trump has been officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office (President, Senate, House of Representatives) under the grounds of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment.

The removal or block is confirmed through official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports. Speculative reports, opinion pieces, or unofficial announcements will not suffice for resolution.

The question will resolve as "No" if these conditions are not met as of July 15, 2024.

Note: The question does not account for legal battles, appeals, or subsequent reversals that might occur *after* the mentioned date. It strictly pertains to whether Donald Trump has been removed from any state's primary election ballot for a federal office under the specified grounds as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is removed or blocked from a ballot and then reinstated, such that as of July 15th he is not removed or blocked from any ballot, the question resolves negatively.

question.title: Will Donald Trump not be removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
question.body:
This question will resolve as "Yes" if, *on* July 15, 2024:

Donald Trump has not been officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office (President, Senate, House of Representatives) under the grounds of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment.

The absence of removal or block is confirmed through the lack of official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports indicating such a removal or block. Speculative reports, opinion pieces, or unofficial announcements will not suffice for resolution.

The question will resolve as "No" if these conditions are not met as of July 15, 2024.

Note: The question does not account for legal battles, appeals, or subsequent reversals that might occur *after* the mentioned date. It strictly pertains to whether Donald Trump has not been removed from any state's primary election ballot for a federal office under the specified grounds as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is removed or blocked from a ballot and then reinstated, such that as of July 15th he is not removed or blocked from any ballot, the question resolves affirmatively.

question.body:
Resolves YES if Biden remains US President through the end of July 2024 (ET); resolves NO if he resigns, dies, or otherwise ceases to be President before then.

Temporary transfer of power under the 25th amendement (i.e. making his VP the Acting President) does not cause a YES resolution. (Acting President is different from President under the Constitution)

question.title: Will Nigel Farage be elected as a Member of Parliament in the July 4 2024 UK General Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** in the event that in the 2024 UK general election held on July 4, 2024, Nigel Farage is elected as the member of parliament (MP) for any UK constituency. The question will resolve as **No** if this does not occur, unless the general election is cancelled or postponed beyond July 4 2024, in which case the question will be **annulled**.

Resolution should cite credible media reports from the BBC, the Times, the Financial Times, the Guardian, or other major UK news sources; or the official announcement of the returning officer for any constituency in which Nigel Farage is a candidate. 

Farage need not be sworn in as an MP for the question to resolve as **Yes** -- this question resolves on the basis of his election or non-election.

The question will resolve as **No** if he is elected, unless the general election is cancelled or postponed beyond July 4 2024, in which case the question will be **annulled**.

Resolution should cite credible media reports from the BBC, the Times, the Financial Times, the Guardian, or other major UK news sources; or the official announcement of the returning officer for any constituency in which Nigel Farage is a candidate. 

Farage need not be sworn in as an MP for the question to resolve as **No** -- this question resolves on the basis of his election or non-election.

question.title: Will Scotland hold an official, sanctioned referendum on independence before May 3, 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if there is a referendum held in Scotland regarding Scotland's independence from the United Kingdom, and this referendum is held before May 3, 2024.  This referendum may be an "advisory" referendum; that is, it is not necessary for the referendum to have any legally binding effect.

It shall not be deemed resolved by a “wildcat” or “Catalan” style of referendum where the UK government has declined permission for the vote, nor by a vote organised by civil society institutions. A referendum must be deemed to have the consent of the London government

question.title: Will Scotland not hold an official, sanctioned referendum on independence before May 3, 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if there is no referendum held in Scotland regarding Scotland's independence from the United Kingdom before May 3, 2024, or if any referendum held does not meet the criteria of being an "official, sanctioned" referendum as specified. This includes referendums that are "wildcat" or "Catalan" style where the UK government has declined permission for the vote or votes organised by civil society institutions without the consent of the London government.
